comment: Class was really easy, graded by quizzes and exams (quizzes are similar to exams) and can be found in the modules given.
There is a whole lot of busy work. Don't feel like I am learning anything just staying super busy with a class that shouldn't have this much work. requires a lot of time to complete the class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework

comment: Didn't hear from him for months at a time. Class was stressful the last few weeks b/c we had a bunch of catchup to do.

One of my favorite classes. I learned a lot from this class. You have 8 short 2 page papers to write through the class. There is a lot of reading because you have to read court cases. Overall I would recommend this class to anyone who wants to learn and is a good writer.

I took this class over the summer & definitely recommend anyone to take it. You like to think that government would be the hardest subject you'll ever take, but he makes it so simple to understand. He is accessible if you have any questions about assignments or powerpoints. He doesn't mind going in-depth if you need extra help understanding.

10/10 recommend he was an amazing professor and person, always tried to be accommodating when help was needed. I took this as a summer semester class and i defiantly recommend awesome class with reasonably timed assignments especially because its a summer class.
one hundred percent would take again. if you have a chance to take it you better

I don't know how he does it. This last semester he was dealing with serious medical issues and yet he always came to class in high spirits. His assignments and lectures are both relevant and involving. If you have any interest in law or government, then look no further. You are pretty much guaranteed a great class with Dr. Gillespie.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Inspirational

comment: He isnt a difficult professor at all, and his class is kinda fun even. Easy grader, and cares for his students. A very good choice for senior seminar.

Really intelligent guy, always willing to help or clearify, and he responds to emails immediately! His lectures can be long and irrelevant to what you're doing in class but still a great professor. I took him for my senior seminar & was never stressed about my final paper or anything! If you put in effort and there is no way you wont get an A!

Prof. Gillespie is amazing! His lecture can get a little boring if you aren't into gov that much. All exams & quizzes are online. Multiple tries on quizzes & 2 attempts on exams. Come to class b/c he gives pop quizzes. Do not skip on simulation days! They are easy and very interesting. You literally have to try not to pass. Take him! Easy A!
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Love him!!! Lectures can be boring, but you need to come to class because he takes attendance for "pop quiz" grades. He's funny, obviously loves what he teaches & is very approachable and caring. Great to boost GPA
If you do not want to stress over your Senior paper take him!  He is very laid back, but still expect to do some work. He will give you great feedback in regards to the paper!
Greatest professor at KSU.

Dr. Gillespie is a very easy grader and a pleasant professor to engage with, but he is also a bit scatterbrained with lecture organization and assignment due dates. Attendance is not graded, but it helps to know when his assignments are due, as due dates change frequently. Aside from minor confusions, he's very much worth your time at KSU.

Fantastic professor! Lectures can be a bit all over the place at times, but that's just because so many interesting points are brought up and he seems to know something about everything. Tests are online and can be semi difficult, just make sure you pay attention and take good notes! Highly recommend, all he wants is for you to learn the material

Very knowledgeable in every aspect of course. Quizzes online, unlimited attempts, takes highest grade, and goes over answers before quizzes are due. 1 test, 1 final, both online, 2 attempts, takes highest grade, bonus section for each. 2 in-class simulations which he allows to be made up. Cares more about you learning it than having difficult tests

I've had Gillespie for three courses now, and can honestly say he's one of the best political science professors Kennesaw State offers. His attitude is, "You're here to learn, so why make it painful?" He's not hard, but teaches well. If you're willing to pay attention, learn, and put in a bit of effort--you'll learn a lot and get an easy A.

Professor Gillespie is an excellent teacher and I learned a lot in his class. He made class extremely interesting.  would highly reccommend taking his class. I hope to have another one of clsses in the future.

He is a easy grader, but there is a lot of work that goes into this class. I learned a lot, but wish class was not that long, but I took it during the summer semester. You have to research cases & answer questions that he gives you using the cases we talked about in class. Very helpful. Clarity on things could be better. Not mandatory to attend.

Cons:  He rambles A LOT - it is sometimes hard to follow the lectures.  He can take quite a while to grade papers.  It can be difficult to write papers because you have to dig through a lot of cases.  Pros:  He is an easy grader.  He is very helpful if you have questions.  He wants you to do well.  NO TEXTBOOK!!!  Pros definitely outweigh the cons.

He is an awesome professor! I've taken 3 of his classes and got A's in all of them. It helps if you attend the class because he goes over all the material you need to know. He does not have tests-- papers only! And you submit them through turnitin. Over all a great professor!

Very easy class! His quizzes are on Ga. View and you can take them as many times as you want until you get perfect score. Those exact questions make up 2/3 of each test. He is very nice and offers extra credit. Go to class though because sometimes he gives random pop quizzes if people leave early or don't show, but they are easy.
Wonderful professor :) My best class this semester. Really understanding and lenient. Supper nice!!! I really recommend taking him.

Great Teacher! I would recommend this class to anyone. 4 tests, no final, online review quizzes. He's not interested in failing you. he really wants you to learn the material. I reaaaaalllyyyy enjoyed this class. DEFINITELY take him if you can! He's VERY funny :)

This is a brilliant professor and an asset to KSU. His lectures are very interesting. He likes students and has a sense of humor.  He is witty and draws on a vast data bank of law, pop culture, and history to illustrate his points with analogies and anecdotes. He gives plenty of time to write intelligent papers and gives good feedback when you do.
This is best professor at KSU. He challenge his students by writing assignments; therefore, no multiple choice nothing, all writing and reading court cases, but he is fair.

Dr. Gillespie gave me an override to take this class.  It is similar to his 4410 class.  You learn it, because this teacher actually teaches! He gives + credit for attendance in the form of easter eggs, and he over explains everything, this class is so easy and informative, a caveman can do it. Seriously though, one of the best teachers at KSU

I don't know where to start.  The most lenient, helpful, and forgiving teacher ever. Teaches Con law and case law in layspeak.  You absolutely need to take this class... take notes or pay attention and it will be hard to not get an A. Best teacher I ever had, because he understands students. You will learn AmLaw, Period!

Interesting class and sometimes teaches in the gazebo outside.No textbook to buy.Gave class option for open-book or take home tests.5 papers but drops lowest grade.Very lenient on assignments and always extended due dates.Take home tests were 8 pages,but easy.Hardly anyone went to class, bc he posts everything on webct.Late when grading assignments

Professor Gillespie knows constitutional law inside-out.  If you take notes you will fill pages every class, there is so much detail, which you can turn around and use for the open notes exams!  Sometimes I wished there were a textbook.  Nice man, a little disorganized but a brilliant mind to pick if you are into con. law.

Open note & open book. Your notes are worth less & the exam questions u have to wonder where he got them. Dont waist ur time studying & working on his SG(i spent 5hrs & was not on final could have been studying for another final instead of wasting my time). Wish i took criminal procedure instead. Not recommended.coming to class was a waist of time.

Dr G. was in fact a great lecturer, very smart, and approachable. There were several problems though: I only knew ONE of my grades throughout the whole semester, because he never gave assignments back, never responded to emails, and was impossible to get ahold of. Also, did not give back first grade until 2 weeks after the date to drop.

I had Dr. Gillespie for my Senior Seminar Online, and I have to say, it was the worst class I ever took. Dr. G never responds to emails. He is almost impossible to get a hold of. He is incredibly slow at returning grades, and he just seemed completely disorganized. Dr. G was friendly, and the class wasn't hard. However,definitely take someone else.
Take this guy...he is easy

Dr. Gillespie is incredibly smart and a great lecturer.  He presents the information in a way that it is easy to remember.  He is fairly lenient in grading, which is nice because his tests are long and difficult.  I would recommend.

POLS 3315, 4405, 4410.  Love taking his class!  He wants you to learn and get A's!   The material is tricky, but he is available to help!  Tries to make classes fun and material interesting!  Exams are open book & note.  That doesn't mean they are easy!  But, he will curve.  Read and keep notes! Great professor!!!!!

He was really easy and helpful.  Will explain things in class but the lectures can be boring.  Does quizes on webct that are soo easy, choice between essay or multi choice exams, and extra credit.  Good guy!

Once again, Dr. Gillespie did not disappoint. I expected Civil Liberties to be a bit monotonous, but I have really missed not having class already.  Everything was explained well, and he used hypotheticals to help us comprehend the material and think on our feet. Love it love it!
He made the content intersting and made it easy to get a good grade, as well.

I was dreading this class before I took it but I was pleasantly surprised at how interesting it actually was.  He is an awesome professor that is more than willing to work with you if you need him to.  I highly reccommend Dr. Gillespie!  At the end of the semester you won't regret it!!!!!

Was not very interested in American Government, but he made it interesting. He is very helpful professor. Gives review quizzes via WebCT. Has study guides for each exam. Gives the option of either taking multiple choice exams or essay exams.

Great Teacher! I have taken 3 classes with him during my time at KSU, if I was not graduating I would keep taking him. He is more than willing to go the extra step to make sure his students understand the material. He is very helpful and geniune. Overall, he is an excellent professor.
Very helpful. Willing to talk to students and make appointments to make sure a student understands the material and provides several review quizes

If you love law then you will love this class.  If not then you will be in pain.  I took this as an elective and it ripped my brain apart.  Dr. Gillespie is very helpful though and does curve so the test that kill don't kill your GPA.
Always great!  There isn't a nicer teacher on campus!  I will take him again and again!  Extra credit, clear expectations, interesting classes, everything is fair and wonderful! Take his class now!

One of the best professors I have ever had!  He really enjoys teaching and is interested in the classes feedback.  He really wants you to understand the material and will add helpful tools to assist in understanding.  Whenever you see his name- take the course.  He is the fairest grader!
If you have to take Government, take this guy!  He's fair, understanding, and pretty cool!  Gives 10 quizzes (easy), 3 Tests (scantron) and some extra credit, too.  No big projects - just lecture.
